content: Most textbooks on marriage and family therapy are Eurocentric. This timely book bridges African and Western traditions, presenting a valuable addition to the literature tailored to the needs of students and scholars in global Africa and the wider world. Common perspectives on sexual orientation are inaccurate. This book establishes criteria for a robust theory, evaluates major perspectives, and proposes the first novel theory in decades: a four-component approach that explains many fascinating sexual orientation occurrences. It dislodges their marginalized position by centering their experience and providing models and strategies for research and practice designed for their benefit. How do we know if someone else is conscious? This book offers a compelling bioethical analysis of one of neuroscience’s most intriguing topics: states of consciousness, bringing together contributions from international experts in neuroscience, philosophy, law, and ethics. Belief in possession has ancient roots. This book traces its global history and explores how mental health professionals can help a person who believes they are possessed. Featuring interviews with exorcists, this is a fascinating study for believers and sceptics alike. Through the lens of cognition, this work explores the symbolic relationship between self and object. It studies how objects are vehicles through which cognitive processes transform our understanding of Self as an ongoing, imaginative endeavor. Modern challenges cause stress and poor health. This book develops the concept of ‘emotional health’ as a bio-psycho-socio-cultural balance, bridging medical treatments with alternative therapies to highlight new solutions to these problems. This book contains research papers in environment-behaviour studies that address a recurring debate: how can research findings be put into real-world practice? It outlines current views and suggestions on how to more effectively address this ‘research-practice’ relationship. This book covers the consequences of death for patients and families, including grief and health. It offers a health promotion perspective on palliative care for patients, families, and care workers, stressing the importance of fulfilling patient wishes. For mental health practitioners, this book describes induced affect, a clinical procedure to counter emotional avoidance and build regulation skills. It provides step-by-step instructions, transcripts, and a stress management program to enhance emotional resilience. This volume adopts a fluid approach to identity, exploring its development in intercultural contexts. With international contributions from diverse fields, it provides empirical research into identification processes for scholars, students, and all interested in diversity. This innovative book explores the relationship between geography and gender from an Indian perspective. It examines how Media Space—a virtual place for ideas and images—is used to construct gender stereotypes through visual media like soap operas. Modernist scholarship has moved beyond solitary figures to the group formations that fostered these movements. The essays in Modernist Group Dynamics explore how artists worked in concert and conflict, reconsidering well-known figures and recovering groups worldwide. National archetypes represent the outstanding traits of their citizens and serve as role models. This study explores how they are formed and their effect on the behaviour of workers and employers, analyzing five European countries and comparing them to non-European archetypes. summary: Buku ini membahas berbagai aspek psikologi, mulai dari psikologi kepribadian, sosial, hingga kriminal, dengan pendekatan yang menggabungkan tradisi Afrika dan Barat, menawarkan kontribusi baru bagi mahasiswa dan peneliti di Afrika dan dunia. Buku ini menyoroti keakuratan pandangan tradisional tentang orientasi seksual, mengusulkan teori baru berbasis empat komponen yang menjelaskan fenomena orientasi seksual secara lebih kuat. Selain itu, buku ini juga membahas tren dan tantangan organisasi di Asia, khususnya Tiongkok, India, dan ASEAN, serta menekankan pentingnya penelitian yang memperhatikan peran perempuan berkulit warna, yang sebelumnya terpinggirkan dalam ilmu sosial. Buku ini juga membahas isu kesadaran, dengan analisis etika biologis dari sisi neurosains, filsafat, hukum, dan etika, serta memperlihatkan bagaimana kepercayaan terhadap penghuni (possession) memiliki akar sejarah global dan bagaimana profesional kesehatan mental dapat membantu individu yang percaya dirinya terpenuhi. Selain itu, buku ini menekankan hubungan simbolis antara diri dan objek melalui proses kognitif, menunjukkan bahwa identitas diri adalah perjalanan imajinatif. Terakhir, buku ini mengusulkan konsep kesehatan emosional sebagai keseimbangan biologis, psikologis, sosial, dan budaya, yang mengintegrasikan perawatan medis dengan pendekatan holistik. Buku ini merupakan kumpulan artikel terkini dari para ahli, memberikan wawasan yang luas dan relevan untuk dunia psikologi global.
